article: Tyler was a troubled student.He was in my senior class last year.It was  _  to his former teachers that he had made it to his senior year. He sat in the back row.Every time I spoke in the front of the class,I would ask students questions,  _  them by name.This helped me learn their names while getting the kids  _  .Unfortunately,every time I asked him a question,he would  _  with a flip answer.He knew the answers when he listened  _  he didn't want to be asked.If he got a wrong answer,he would get very angry. One day,Tyler was talking while I was teaching.In the  _  of teaching I said,"Tyler,why are you having your own discussion instead of  _  ours?" With that,he  got up  from his chair,pushed it over,and yelled.I sent him to the office with a discipline referral,and he  _  a week's out of school suspension. The week's out of school suspension was wonderful.However,the week soon came to a(n)  _  ,and I began to worry about his  _  .I knew from talking with his other teachers that he would be back even angrier. I made a(n)  _  .On the day that he came back,I stood at the door  waiting for  him.As soon as I saw him,I asked him to talk for a moment.He seemed  _  to do it but agreed.I told him that I wanted to start over with him.Furthermore,I gave him permission that if he felt he was going to lose  _  in class he could step right outside the door for a moment to collect himself. From that point on,Tyler was a(n)  _  student in my classroom.He listened and participated.He was  _  a smart child and I could finally get to see this in him.He even  _  a fight between two other students one day.I  _  that giving him the power to decide for himself made all the  _  .
